meanings.definition: Immunomodulators: substances that modify or regulate the immune system.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed immunomodulators to help regulate my immune system.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the effects of immunomodulators on the immune system.
meanings.sent3: I heard immunomodulators can make your immune system dance like a robot!
meanings.sent4: Her ability to control the immune system was like using immunomodulators to adjust a thermostat.
meanings.sent5: The immunomodulators acted like conductors orchestrating the immune system's performance.

meanings.definition: Immunomodulators: drugs that alter the body's immune response.
meanings.sent1: The pharmacist explained how immunomodulators can change the body's immune response.
meanings.sent2: Patients with autoimmune diseases often rely on immunomodulators to manage their symptoms.
meanings.sent3: Taking immunomodulators is like giving your immune response a surprise party!
meanings.sent4: The immunomodulators were like skilled painters, reshaping the body's immune response.
meanings.sent5: The effects of the immunomodulators on the immune response were as clear as day.

meanings.definition: Immunomodulators: agents that affect the functioning of the immune system.
meanings.sent1: Scientists are researching how different agents can impact the immune system using immunomodulators.
meanings.sent2: The hospital stocked various immunomodulators to treat conditions affecting the immune system.
meanings.sent3: Using immunomodulators is like giving the immune system a pep talk before a big game!
meanings.sent4: The immunomodulators acted as conductors, directing the orchestra of the immune system.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the immunomodulators on the functioning of the immune system was remarkable.
